column8: http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...ing-opposition/The StarWednesday, 8 March 2017 | MYT 9:27 PMFormer Malacca DAP chief questions alleged inaction over dubious land deals involving Oppositionby r.s.n. muraliMALACCA: Former Malacca DAP chairman Goh Leong San (pic) has accused an Opposition assemblyman's aide and a PAS Youth leader of being involved in a dubious land deal worth RM1mil.At the state assembly here Wednesday, the Duyong assemblyman, who is now an independent, said three Malacca smallholders had lodged a police report on Dec 14 last year after losing their hard-earned money over a dubious land deal in Ulu Gerik, Kelantan."I want to ask the august house why there were no investigations were done over the police report lodged by poor farmers who were duped into parting with their savings to lease 220ha of land in Kelantan?" he questioned.Goh said the three victims had lost some RM1mil in the scam which was allegedly paid to a DAP assemblyman's aide and a Kelantan PAS Youth leader in the deal made in 2012.He also claimed that the three victims were also told to omit the name of a DAP assemblyman from their police report under threat of a defamation suit.Goh claimed the money was transferred out from the aides' bank account just after the police report was lodged."I am asking the assembly today to support an investigation by police and also the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) into this high-profile cheating case," he said.Goh also told the assembly that he would expose another land scam allegedly involving Malacca DAP leaders once he had obtained the police report from the victims."This time, the size of land involved totals 440ha, also in Kelantan," he said.
